Posted By: Cyberium (6/5/2013 12:53:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"Sweet card in EDH."  
@tut07 This is a sweet cards in many formats :D  
  
I like the fact that Wizards went for the exact same flavor text and artwork in every printing of this card so far.  
And rightly so, i just adore Terese Nielsen's art.  
It's immediately recognizable, and the atmosphere just feels right for this card: The calmness, the isolation, her idle yet attentive pose, the beams of light breaking through the unseen canopy, probably alluding to the original [Regrowth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Regrowth).  
Brilliant.  
  
Plus, you still have a rather unotrusive details that reminds us that she's in *The Tangle* of Mirrodin:  
Not her entire outfit is made of ivy; those are actually green-colored metal plates on her shoulders. And most notably, the blue metal on her front is probably part of her body, a trademark exclusive for folks of that metal plane.
posts.html:
"Sweet card in EDH."

And rightly so, i just adore Terese Nielsen's art.
It's immediately recognizable, and the atmosphere just feels right for this card: The calmness, the isolation, her idle yet attentive pose, the beams of light breaking through the unseen canopy, probably alluding to the original Regrowth.
Brilliant.

Plus, you still have a rather unotrusive details that reminds us that she's in The Tangle of Mirrodin:
Not her entire outfit is made of ivy; those are actually green-colored metal plates on her shoulders. And most notably, the blue metal on her front is probably part of her body, a trademark exclusive for folks of that metal plane.

Posted By: tut07 (6/7/2013 1:51:02 PM)

posts.post_content:
There are a few creatures out there like this that can fetch itself over and over as a recurring blocker. For instance if one is in the grave and you block with the other, you can fetch it back the next turn; which is powerful in occasional instances.   
  
Use her card advantage to fetch card advantage cards ;). I run her next to [Yavimaya Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yavimaya Elder), [Krosan Tusker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krosan Tusker), and [Rune-Scarred Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rune-Scarred Demon)
posts.html:
There are a few creatures out there like this that can fetch itself over and over as a recurring blocker. For instance if one is in the grave and you block with the other, you can fetch it back the next turn; which is powerful in occasional instances.

Use her card advantage to fetch card advantage cards ;). I run her next to Yavimaya Elder, Krosan Tusker, and Rune-Scarred Demon
